page.title: 15LEVENS HALL
page.content: Levens Hall is the Cumbria home of Hal and Susan Bagot. The house is divided into three main periods: the first when the de Redman family built the pele tower and hall about l250 - l300: the second about l570 - 90 when the next family, the Bellinghams, cousins of the de Redmans made the grim medieval shell into a gentleman's residence; and lastly when Colonel James Grahme, first cousin of the last Bellingham, finished the house with his exquisite taste about l680. The rooms of the house have been kept as near to the orginal as possible with furniture, drapes, carpets and utensils dating back over many years. The grounds and gardens, particularly the topiary which was started in l692, are a significant feature of the property.
